text: on Ponce I snapped with my right hand
with my fingers on the laces but on
field-goal I turn it around and put the
laces on my left hand the reason I do
that is because once I start my
operation once the ball has left my
hands I have to get it a perfect exact
rotation two and a half so when when our
holder catches the ball you know seven
and a half yards the laces are out I put
my finger there and keep that there so I
know where to place the ball and cuz we
like to keep Josh on on a yard line
because he likes the ball on like the
corner of a yard marker because it kind
of gives him a visual reference point I
look back at Josh Josh will give me the
head nod that he's found his aiming
point and once he nods at me I look back
at Zack put my hand up and then when I
give this set call usually the ball
follows quickly thereafter I know as
soon as my elbow hits my knee I'm at
least in the vicinity within two square
inches I'm also trying to find the laces
on the ball and so I'm moving them out
as I'm putting the ball down
I start with my right foot right where I
want the ball so I'll put it
